com.github.naoghuman.lib.logger.core

Class LoggerFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.naoghuman.lib.logger.core.LoggerFacade
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger

    public final class LoggerFacade
extends Object
implements Logger
    The facade LoggerFacade provides access to the logging methods during the Interface Logger.
    Author:
    Naoghuman
    See Also:
    Logger

      void debug(Class clazz, String msg)
      Prints a specific message in debug-mode for the given Class if (deactive == FALSE) and (isDebugEnabled() == TRUE).

      Prints a specific message in debug-mode with a throwable for the given Class if (deactive == FALSE) and (isDebugEnabled() == TRUE).

      • deactivate

        public final void deactivate(Boolean deactivate)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Alloweds the developer to decide if the Logger should log or not.
        Can be usefull during testing purpose.
        Specified by:
        deactivate in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        deactivate - Boolean which defined if the Logger should log or not. TRUE if no logging desired, otherwise FALSE for logging.

      • define

        public final void define(org.apache.logging.log4j.Level level)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Lets the developer define a log Level which will be used in the methods Logger.own(Class, String) and Logger.own(Class, String, Throwable). Default is Level.DEBUG.

        All levels are allowed expected Level.ALL and Level.OFF.

        Specified by:
        define in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        level - The Level which should be used.
        See Also:
        Level, Logger.own(Class, String), Logger.own(Class, String, Throwable)

      • message

        public final void message(char borderSign,
                          int borderSignCount,
                          String figlet)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        This will print a Figlet or normal message in the logfile.
        For example with LoggerFacade.getDefault().message('#', 70, figlet); following will print to the log-file:

        #####################################################################
        Here you will see your message.
        #####################################################################

        Have a look at http://www.lemoda.net/games/message/message-instant.html how to generate a message-message.

        Specified by:
        message in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        borderSign - The signsign represent an element from the border.
        borderSignCount - Define how much elements have the border.
        figlet - The figlet (or in normal format) message between the border.

      • own

        public final void own(Class clazz,
                      String msg)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Prints a specific message in the defined log Level mode when (deactive == FALSE) and (isLogModeEnabled() == TRUE). The developer can the log level define in the method Logger.define(Level). Default is that Level.DEBUG.
        Specified by:
        own in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for that the message should be printed.
        msg - The message which should be printed.
        See Also:
        Logger.define(Level)

      • own

        public final void own(Class clazz,
                      String msg,
                      Throwable ta)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Prints a specific message in the defined log Level mode when (deactive == FALSE) and (isLogModeEnabled() == TRUE). The developer can the log level define in the method Logger.define(Level). Default is that Level.DEBUG.
        Specified by:
        own in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for that the message should be printed.
        msg - The message which should be printed.
        ta - The error which is thrown.
        See Also:
        Logger.define(Level)
